text: <@U3A4KEWK1> I've been going down the `navigator.language` path, but I've found the object it returns somewhat unreliable.  I live in Canada and have my browsers language preference set to en-CA but `navigator.language` still returns en-US.  I'm probably just going to end up hitting a geolocation API with the user's IP data and going from there

You actually don't need an API to get location data, HubSpot has that
```"request": {
    "geoip_city": "columbus",
    "geoip_organization": "time warner cable internet",
    "geoip_region": "ohio",
    "geoip_country": "us",
    "geoip_dma": null
}```
I don't know how reliable it is, though it's correctly gotten my location every time I've looked at it
You can see that in developer info
Yeah, as you can see, we do a GeoIP lookup for every request that you can use. <https://dev.maxmind.com/geoip/legacy/downloadable/>
Is there a max blog topic count??
I tried to pull 700 and max it gave me was 300
I feel like I wasn't getting enough
